availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Fleming County, Kentucky resident. Kentucky native. Married Eliza Power Fleming. Father of Held three slaves in 1860. Cybel Fleming, James Fleming, Richard Fleming, Franklin Fleming, John Fleming, Walter Fleming, Hugh Fleming, Ida Fleming, and Florence Fleming.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, District 1, p. 334. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, District 1. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, District 1, p. 855. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, District 1. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, Flemingsburg, p. 393. “William Fleming (1806-1887),” Find A Grave, memorial no. 113856027, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=113856027&ref=acom (accessed June 16, 2017).
